content: in this age of being green why not make yourself a little gift bag the size is easy to customize & the bag is quick to make after your recipient opens his gift he can reuse the bag for next year s gift to you finished size approx 5 5 by 6 by anastaciaknits on ravelry/ anastaciaknits@gmail com / http //anastaciaknits net gauge 3 sts = 1 in pattern gauge not important materials  1 5 ounces worsted weight yarn 90-110 yards this pattern is perfect for using up scraps i used acrylic for my bags cotton also works well but you can use any fiber you desire  size g hook  yarn needle chain 16 if you desire a bigger or smaller bag simply chain more or less stitches in multiples of 2 round 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook double_crochet in next chain single_crochet in next chain repeat across until last chain single_crochet double_crochet in last chain do not turn working in opposite side of the beginning chain double_crochet in next chain single_crochet in next chain until last chain single_crochet double_crochet in last chain do not join but work in continuous rounds for rest of pattern round 2-12 double_crochet in first single_crochet single_crochet in next double_crochet repeat around bag as many rounds as desired until bag measures approximately 1 less than the desired height of bag i worked for about 5 do not turn eyelet row chain 1 skip next stitch single_crochet in next st repeat around entire round next 3 rounds single_crochet in chain 1 space double_crochet in single_crochet repeat around bag cut yarn weave in ends & enjoy feel free to make as many of these as you like for local craft fairs/auctions/raffles/bazaars but please do not sell finished items online the pattern itself is not for sale if making for charity please let me know the name of the charity & include my contact info with the bag anastaciaknits@gmail com / anastaciaknits on ravelry thanks thanks to missrach bjclark63 & clairea for testing the pattern and to jennbelcher vapmore and pitzapooh for their proofreading/tech editing/general all-around suggestions also a big thank you goes out to the the testing pool group on ravelry copyright 2010 anastaciaknits on ravelry
